head.title: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: xsl:include

meta.name: title
meta.content: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: xsl:include

body.p: The xsl:include element is always used at the top level of the stylesheet. It has a mandatory href attribute, which is a URL (absolute or relative) of another stylesheet to be textually included within this one. The top-level elements of the included stylesheet effectively replace the xsl:include element.
xsl:include may also be used at the top level of the included stylesheet, and so on recursively.
